medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at 36 weeks' gestation with a history of type 2B von Willebrand disease diagnosed in childhood. Platelet counts had fluctuated during her pregnancies, with a count of 20,000/giga/l during her previous delivery. In this pregnancy, platelet count was 46,000/giga/l during consultation, dropping to 36,000/giga/l at delivery and further to 30,000/giga/l shortly after transfusions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic hepatitis C without liver dysfunction, type 2B von Willebrand disease, and a strong family history of type 2B vWD.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes grandmother, mother, uncle, and brother all diagnosed with type 2B von Willebrand disease.
